description: Document and improve use of various disconnects
Add particle effects when cutting down a tree
Move SDL functions and types to a namespace
Throw exceptions where appropriate on SDL-function failures
Sort _materials and _craftableItems by name, not ID
Optimize container types for faster iteration
Change dynamic_casts that don't check their result to static_cast or check for nullptr
Use forward declarations where possible, to reduce unnecessary #includes
Add grass objects, which grow naturally on grass tiles
Allow a recipe to create multiple item types
Use set::count() and map::count() to test set membership
Move appropriate configuration details into config file
Choose gather item based on gathers left, not nominal quantity
Prevent gathering/deconstructing when object has an inventory
Allow giving away or begging for goods via trade
Fix ambiguity of Object::removeItem() and Object::removeItems()
isLocationValid() only checks one point against one terrain tile/chunk
Move client colors to config file instead of hardcoding
Players can move through small objects
Only save map data once, on generation
Empty objects reported as not empty when attempting to dismantle
Use namespaces for server and client
Deal constant damage every 1s when close to target
Allow aggressive and normal targeting on right/left click
Memoize texture for other users' names
Make client-side NPCs a subclass of ClientObject
Avoid multiple data loads for custom server data
Blood particles for attacking and death, that remain for a time
Stacks of the same item can be combined
Remove useItem info from Container class; move it into Client object
Close client on single Esc press when disconnected
Player can get stuck against terrain or NPCs
NPCs get stuck on each other due to linear pathfinding
Fail more gracefully and informatively when can't connect to server
A boat that's restricted to water
Server loads map from data file, rather than generating it
Client loads map from data file, not via server messages
Heavy objects that prevent player movement
Energy bar used up by attacking
Each player can build one 'shrine'-class object
A shrine that grants a buff
A shrine that sets one's spawn point
A road object that affects movement speed
A hoe constructs a farm plot without being consumed
Seeds, that are constructed on top of a farm-plot object
A crop object that grows over time
Containers may allow 'heavy' objects or not
Players/factions can fight over object ownership
Some tools objects have a cooldown
Containers may be restricted by item class
Recipes, objects and loot tables may point to deleted ServerItems
Use collisionRects even on non-colliding objects
Color mouse-over outline based on whether in range
Non-NPC objects always collide with each other
Tool requirements not enforced for crafting
Allow tool objects to show an in-use image/animation
Use doubles, not ints, in Rect class
Tool requirements not showing up in crafting window
Make client connection failures more clean
Load map in client before connecting
A 'handcart' vehicle that a player can mount, drive, and dismount
Users are drawn inside (front+back) of vehicles
Make terrain white/blacklists per object, not per spawn point
Server can't handle client timing out
Prevent clipping in getTileCoords() due to random coord at map edge
Prevent mouse-over events on particles and decorations
Use the word 'destroy' in confirmation window
Find a way of hiding recipes
Let window titles expand window width
Mouse-down events are propagating to multiple windows
Require tools, gather-req items, etc. to be equipped
Reduce calls to findUsersInArea() in NPC AI
Include only known-recipe info in filters
Use simpler walls in login screen
Add esc menu to release client
Calculate highlight borders by adjacency to magenta (sausage man)
Remove 'can ...' tooltips when player has no permissions
Allow crafting if removing the ingredients will make room
Make players and objects more visible on map
Use gear-slot names, not numbers, in items.xml
Add fading unlock messages to the top of the screen
Prevent chat messages being cut off
Highlight recipes/constructions that might unlock stuff
Items and objects can be repaired with materials
